revised_title: Spectra of Metallic Arcs in an Exhausted Globe
tldr: The authors investigate the spectra of metallic arcs, such as magnesium, zinc, and cadmium, when placed in an exhausted globe. They observe that certain lines, known as enhanced lines, become more prominent under these conditions, and discuss the implications of these findings for understanding the behavior of metallic arcs and their applications in determining relative stellar temperatures.
